author: Staff Reporter
text:
About 46 per cent polling was registered in the by-elections to three communally-sensitive Assembly seats of Muzaffarnagar, Deoband and Bikapur in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday till 5 p.m., said the Uttar Pradesh Chief Election Officer. The percentage could go up as a large number of people were seen queuing up outside the booths, said the CEO.

In Deoband the polling was 50 per cent, and in Muzaffarnagar it was 44 and in Bikapur it was 45 per cent. The elections were peaceful.

The polls were necessitated after the death of sitting Samajwadi Party MLAs Chitaranjan Swaroop (Muzaffarnagar) and Rajinder Rana (Deoband) and Mitrasen Yadav (Bikapur).

The counting of votes will be held on February 16.
title: 46% polling in U.P. by-elections
